alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 20 at 12:01PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Bellevue affecting Williamson and Davidson Counties. For the Harpeth River...including Bellevue...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Bellevue. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Portions of the Harpeth River Greenway begin to be inundated, and water begins to inundate the parking lot of the Harpeth River State Park at Highway 100. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 14.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest later this evening. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 600 AM CST.
